deity.name: Ondisso
deity.description: Ondisso is an agathion empyreal lord
deity.source: Paizo Publishing - Inner Sea Gods, p.322

skills.list_mods: Knowledge (Religion) +8, Perception +16, Sense Motive +19, Spellcraft +8, Survival +6

checklist.name: Channel Positive Energy (Su)
checklist.description: You can unleash a wave of positive energy. You must choose to deal 6d6 points of positive energy damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures of 6d6 points of damage. Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a DC 16 Will save to halve the damage. You can use this ability 4 times per day.

checklist.name: Freedom's Call (Su)
checklist.description: You can emit a 30-foot aura of freedom for 10 rounds per day. Allies within this aura are not affected by the confused, grappled, frightened, panicked, paralyzed, pinned, or shaken conditions. This aura only suppresses these effects, and they return once a creature leaves the aura or when the aura ends, if applicable. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.

checklist.name: Liberation (Su)
checklist.description: You have the ability to ignore impediments to your mobility. For 10 rounds per day, you can move normally regardless of magical effects that impede movement, as if you were affected by Freedom of Movement. This effect occurs automatically as soon as it applies. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.

feat.name: Alignment Channel (Evil)
feat.description: You can channel your divine energy to harm or heal outsiders that possess your chosen alignment subtype.
feat.benefit: Instead of its normal effect, you can choose to have your ability to channel energy heal or harm outsiders of the chosen alignment subtype. You must make this choice each time you channel energy. If you choose to heal or harm creatures of the chosen alignment subtype, your channel energy has no effect on other creatures. The amount of damage healed or dealt and the DC to halve the damage is otherwise unchanged.

feat.name: Deadly Aim
feat.description: You can make exceptionally deadly ranged attacks by pinpointing a foe's weak spot, at the expense of making the attack less likely to succeed.
feat.benefit: You can choose to take a -3 penalty on all ranged attack rolls to gain a +6 bonus on all ranged damage rolls. You must choose to use this feat before making an attack roll and its effects last until your next turn. The bonus damage does not apply to touch attacks or effects that do not deal hit point damage.

feat.name: Point Blank Master (Weapon Specialization (Crossbow (Light)))
feat.description: You are adept at firing ranged weapons in close quarters.
feat.benefit: Choose one type of ranged weapon. You do not provoke attacks of opportunity when firing the selected weapon while threatened.
feat.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.167

feat.name: Point-Blank Shot
feat.description: You are especially accurate when making ranged attacks against close target.
feat.benefit: You get a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons at ranges of up to 30 feet.

feat.name: Precise Strike
feat.description: You are skilled at striking where it counts, as long as an ally distracts your foe.
feat.benefit: Whenever you and an ally who also has this feat are flanking the same the creature, you deal an additional 1d6 points of precision damage with each successful melee attack. This bonus damage stacks with other sources of precision damage, such as sneak attack. This bonus damage is not multiplied on a critical hit.
feat.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.167

feat.name: Rapid Reload (Crossbow (Light))
feat.description: You can reload your chosen type of crossbow quickly. Choose a type of crossbow (hand, light, heavy) or a single type of one-handed or two-handed firearm that you are proficient with. You can reload such a weapon quickly. (revised to include firearms in Ultimate Combat p.115) You can reload your chosen type of weapon quickly.

benefit.para: The time required for you to reload your chosen type of crossbow is reduced to a free action (for a hand or light crossbow) or a move action (for a heavy crossbow). Reloading a crossbow still provokes an attack of opportunity. If you have selected this feat for hand crossbow or light crossbow, you may fire that weapon as many times in a full-attack action as you could attack if you were using a bow. The time required for you to reload your chosen type of weapon is reduced to a free action (for a hand or light crossbow), a move action (for heavy crossbow or onehanded firearm), or a standard action (two-handed firearm). Reloading a crossbow or firearm still provokes attacks of opportunity. If you have selected this feat for a hand crossbow or light crossbow, you may fire that weapon as many times in a full-attack action as you could attack if you were using a bow.

[Normal] A character without this feat needs a move action to reload a hand or light crossbow, a standard action to reload a one-handed firearm, or a full-round action to load a heavy crossbow or a two-handed firearm.

[Special]You can gain Rapid Reload multiple times. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of crossbow or a new type of firearm. The time required for you to reload your chosen type of weapon is reduced to a free action (for a hand or light crossbow), a move action (for a heavy crossbow or one-handed firearm), or a standard action (for a two-handed firearm). Reloading a crossbow or firearm still provokes an attack of opportunity. If you have selected this feat for hand crossbow or light crossbow, you may fire that weapon as many times in a full-attack action as you could attack if you were using a bow.

feat.source: Paizo Inc. - Inner Sea World Guide, ISWG p.288

feat.name: Rapid Shot
feat.description: You can make an additional ranged attack.
feat.benefit: When making a full-attack action with a ranged weapon, you can fire one additional time this round. All of your attack rolls take a -2 penalty when using Rapid Shot.

feat.name: Shield Focus
feat.description: You are skilled at deflecting blows with your shield.
feat.benefit: Increase the AC bonus granted by any shield you are using by 1.

feat.name: Weapon Focus (Crossbow (Light))
feat.description: You are especially good at using your chosen weapon.
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on all attack rolls you make using the selected weapon.

feat.name: Weapon Specialization (Crossbow (Light))
feat.description: You deal extra damage when using your chosen weapon.
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon.

archetype.name: Crusader
archetype.description: Crusaders serve the militant arm of a church, ready to stand guard over the religion's holy places and to be its swift, avenging arm against those who resist its truth.

special_quality.name: Aura (Ex)
special_quality.description: A cleric of a chaotic, evil, good, or lawful deity has a particularly powerful aura corresponding to the deity's alignment (see the detect evil spell for details).

special_quality.name: Aura of Good (Ex)
special_quality.description: You project a strong good aura.

special_quality.name: Bonus Feat
special_quality.description: A crusader gains a bonus feat at 1st level, then again at 5th level and every five levels thereafter (to a maximum of six at 20th level). These bonus feats must be chosen from the following list - Heavy Armor Proficiency, Improved Shield Bash, Martial Weapon Proficiency, Saving Shield, Shield Focus, Tower Shield Proficiency, and Weapon Focus*. At 10th level, a crusader may also choose from the following feats - Exotic Weapon Proficiency, Greater Shield Focus, Greater Weapon Focus*, Improved Critical*, Shield Slam, Shield Specialization, and Weapon Specialization*. At 20th level, a crusader may also choose from the following feats - Greater Shield Specialization and Greater Weapon Specialization*. Bonus feats marked with an asterisk (*) must be applied to the favored weapon of the crusader's deity. A crusader need not meet the normal class- or level-based prerequisites for these bonus feats.

special_quality.name: Bonus Feat
special_quality.description: Humans select one extra feat at 1st level.

special_quality.name: Diminished Spellcasting
special_quality.description: A crusader chooses only one domain and gains one fewer spell of each level than normal. If this reduces the number to 0, she may cast spells of that level only if they are domain spells or if her Wisdom allows bonus spells of that level.

special_quality.name: Freedom's Call (Su)
special_quality.description: You can emit a 30-foot aura of freedom for 10 rounds per day. Allies within this aura are not affected by the confused, grappled, frightened, panicked, paralyzed, pinned, or shaken conditions. This aura only suppresses these effects, and they return once a creature leaves the aura or when the aura ends, if applicable. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
special_quality.aspect: Ability Benefit: (10 rounds/day), CheckCount: 10, CheckType: Rounds per Day

special_quality.name: Legion's Blessing (Su)
special_quality.description: At 8th level, a crusader gains the ability to confer beneficial spells quickly to a large group of allies. As a full-round action, the crusader may confer the effects of a single harmless spell with a range of touch to a number of creatures equal to half her cleric level. The spell's range remains touch, so all intended recipients must be within the crusader's reach when the spell is cast. Using the legion's blessing expends the prepared spell, but it also requires the crusader to sacrifice another prepared spell three levels higher, as when spontaneously using a cure or inflict spell. The higher-level spell is not cast but is simply lost, its magical energy used to power the legion's blessing.

special_quality.name: Liberation (Su)
special_quality.description: You have the ability to ignore impediments to your mobility. For 10 rounds per day, you can move normally regardless of magical effects that impede movement, as if you were affected by Freedom of Movement. This effect occurs automatically as soon as it applies. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
special_quality.aspect: Ability Benefit: (10 rounds/day), CheckCount: 10, CheckType: Rounds per Day

special_quality.name: Orisons
special_quality.description: You can prepare a number of orisons, or 0-level spells. These spells are cast like any other spells, but they are not expended when used and may be used again.

special_quality.name: Skilled
special_quality.description: Humans gain an additional skill rank at first level and one additional rank whenever they gain a level.

special_quality.name: Spontaneous Casting
special_quality.description: You can channel stored spell energy into healing spells that you did not prepare ahead of time. You can "lose" any prepared spell that is not an orison or domain spell in order to cast any cure spell of the same spell level or lower (a cure spell is any spell with "Cure" in its name).

special_quality.name: Vindicator's Shield (Su)
special_quality.description: A vindicator can channel energy into his shield as a standard action; when worn, the shield gives the vindicator a sacred bonus (if positive energy) or profane bonus (if negative energy) to his Armor Class equal to the number of dice of the vindicator's channel energy. This bonus lasts for 24 hours or until the vindicator is struck in combat, whichever comes first. The shield does not provide this bonus to any other wielder, but the vindicator does not need to be holding the shield for it to retain this power.

special_attack.name: Channel Positive Energy (Su)
special_attack.description: You can unleash a wave of positive energy. You must choose to deal 6d6 points of positive energy damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures of 6d6 points of damage. Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a DC 16 Will save to halve the damage. You can use this ability 4 times per day.
special_attack.aspect: Ability Benefit: (6d6, DC 16, 4/day), CheckCount: 4, CheckType: Uses per day

trait.name: Lessons of Faith
trait.description: You have a knack for avoiding trouble.

trait.name: Magical Knack (Cleric)
trait.description: You were raised, either wholly or in part, by a magical creature, either after it found you abandoned in the woods or because your parents often left you in the care of a magical minion. This constant exposure to magic has made its mysteries easy for you to understand, even when you turn your mind to other devotions and tasks. Your caster level in Cleric gains a +2 trait bonus as long as this bonus doesn't raise your caster level above your current Hit Dice.
trait.source: Paizo Inc. - Second Darkness Player's Guide, p.13

domain.name: Liberation
domain.power: You are a spirit of freedom and a staunch foe against all who would enslave and oppress.

spell.name: Abstemiousness
spell.effect: This spell magically enhances a handful of simple food, imbuing it with enough nutrition to satisfy a Medium or smaller creature for a full day. The spell does not create food, and thus will not alone prevent someone from starving, but it can extend even limited reserves for lengthy periods.
spell.target: a handful of berries, grains, nuts, or rice

spell.name: Deathwine
spell.effect: This spell allows you to turn a potion into a temporary pool of necromantic energy. Only a potion created using a conjuration [healing] spell can be affected by this spell. An affected potion turns dark red and reveals a necromantic aura it detect magic is cast on it while it remains under this spell's effects. When you drink a potion affected by this spell, you do not gain the potion's normal effect. Instead, the first necromancy spell you cast within the next minute is cast at a higher caster level. The bonus to caster level is equal to the spell level of the spell used to create the potion that deathwine affects. For example, a 5th-level wizard who drinks death wine made from a potion of cure serious wounds would cast his next necromancy spell as an 8th-level caster, as cure serious wounds is a 3rdlevel spell. In addition, any undead creature [or other creature healed by negative energy] that drinks a potion affected by deathwine is healed of 1d8 points of damage. Any potion not imbibed before this spell's duration expires is destroyed at the end of the deathwine's duration.

source.source: Paizo Publishing - Rise of the Runelords Adventure Path, p.418

spell.description: This spell allows you to turn a potion into a temporary pool of necromantic energy. Only a potion created using a conjuration (healing) spell can be affected by this spell. An affected potion turns dark red and reveals a necromantic aura it detect magic is cast on it while it remains under this spell's effects. When you drink a potion affected by this spell, you do not gain the potion's normal effect. Instead, the first necromancy spell you cast within the next minute is cast at a higher caster level. The bonus to caster level is equal to the spell level of the spell used to create the potion that deathwine affects. For example, a 5th-level wizard who drinks death wine made from a potion of cure serious wounds would cast his next necromancy spell as an 8th-level caster, as cure serious wounds is a 3rdlevel spell. In addition, any undead creature (or other creature healed by negative energy) that drinks a potion affected by deathwine is healed of 1d8 points of damage. Any potion not imbibed before this spell's duration expires is destroyed at the end of the deathwine's duration.

spell.name: Sharesister
spell.components: V, S, M (a drop of your own blood)
spell.effect: Ithuna Vardsdottir claims to have unearthed this ancient prayer in a ruined temple of Desna, though Pathfinders have reported the use of similar magic in Irrisen among the White Witches. While the name of this spell is sharesister, it works equally well on male or female creatures–both targets of the spell must simply be of the same gender. When you deliver the spell, you receive a negative level for the duration of the spell, and the other target receives a +1 insight bonus to her caster level and a +1 insight bonus to the save DCs of all of her spells. At 11th level, you can opt to take four negative levels to grant a +2 insight bonus to the other target's caster level and spell save DCs if you wish, while at 17th level you can take 6 negative levels to increase the insight bonus to +3. Any effect that removes or prevents the negative level immediately ends the sharesister spell. Negative levels received from the spell vanish as soon as this spell effect ends. Negative levels from multiple castings of this spell stack.
spell.target: You and one creature of your gender

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Pathfinder Society Field Guide, p.58

spell.description: Ithuna Vardsdottir claims to have unearthed this ancient prayer in a ruined temple of Desna, though Pathfinders have reported the use of similar magic in Irrisen among the White Witches. When you deliver the spell, you receive a negative level for the duration of the spell, and the other target receives a +1 insight bonus to her caster level and a +1 insight bonus to the save DCs of all of her spells. At 11th level, you can opt to take four negative levels to grant a +2 insight bonus to the other target's caster level and spell save DCs if you wish, while at 17th level you can take 6 negative levels to increase the insight bonus to +3. spell.name: Gilded Whispers
spell.components: V, S, M (100 gp of powdered gemstones)
spell.effect: Developed by priests of Abadar to catch thieves and skimmers, gilded whispers later spread to other faiths and was adapted to the arcane arts through the combined efforts of Aram Zey and Kreighton Shaine. Pathfinders most commonly use this spell to track bribes and illicit purchases back to their ultimate source, especially when they suspect the influence of Aspis Consortium agents. Gilded whispers allows you to use a single coin as a conduit for an eavesdropping spell. When you use a divination [scrying] spell or item, such as clairvoyance/ clairaudience, scrying, or a crystal ball, you can choose to target a coin you have affected with gilded whispers instead of a creature or location [even if you would not otherwise be able to target an object], though any range limits on the scrying effect still apply. If the coin is held or carried by a creature, its owner receives any applicable saving throw against the effect. The caster of gilded whispers treats the coin as a familiar subject. The residual psychic impressions left upon the coin by other handlers help mask this dweomer from detection, protecting gilded whispers against location by detect magic, arcane sight, and similar effects unless the latter spell's caster succeeds on a caster level check [1d20 + caster level] against a DC of 11 + the caster level of the spellcaster who cast gilded whispers. The scrying sensor created by using a divination [scrying] spell to observe or listen to the coin's surroundings can be detected as normal.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Pathfinder Society Field Guide, p.57

spell.description: Developed by priests of Abadar to catch thieves and skimmers, gilded whispers later spread to other faiths and was adapted to the arcane arts through the combined efforts of Aram Zey and Kreighton Shaine. Pathfinders most commonly use this spell to track bribes and illicit purchases back to their ultimate source, especially when they suspect the influence of Aspis Consortium agents. Gilded whispers allows you to use a single coin as a conduit for an eavesdropping spell. When you use a divination (scrying) spell or item, such as clairvoyance/ clairaudience, scrying, or a crystal ball, you can choose to target a coin you have affected with gilded whispers instead of a creature or location (even if you would not otherwise be able to target an object), though any range limits on the scrying effect still apply. If the coin is held or carried by a creature, its owner receives any applicable saving throw against the effect. The caster of gilded whispers treats the coin as a familiar subject. The residual psychic impressions left upon the coin by other handlers help mask this dweomer from detection, protecting gilded whispers against location by detect magic, arcane sight, and similar effects unless the latter spell's caster succeeds on a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against a DC of 11 + the caster level of the spellcaster who cast gilded whispers. The scrying sensor created by using a divination (scrying) spell to observe or listen to the coin's surroundings can be detected as normal.

spell.description: Hallow makes a particular site, building, or structure a holy site.

spell.name: Holy Ice
spell.components: V, S, M (holy water or 25 gp powdered silver)
spell.duration: 11 minutes, instantaneous, or until expended [see text]
spell.effect: Create wall or javelins of frozen holy water.
spell.target: Wall of ice or flying javelins [see text]
spell.description: Create wall or javelins of frozen holy water.

spell.name: Inflict Light Wounds (Mass)
spell.effect: Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing 1d8+11 points of damage to nearby living enemies.
spell.target: 11 creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
spell.description: Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing 1d8+(min(25,CASTERLEVEL)) points of damage to nearby living enemies.

spell.name: Insect Plague
spell.effect: You summon a number of swarms of wasps.
spell.target: One swarm of wasps per three levels, each of which must be adjacent to at least one other swarm
spell.description: You summon a number of swarms of wasps.

spell.name: Life Bubble
spell.components: V, S, M/DF (a bit of eggshell)
spell.effect: Protects creatures from sustained environmental effects.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.230

spell.description: Protects creatures from sustained environmental effects.

spell.name: Lighten Object (Mass)
spell.effect: Decrease target objects' weight by half.
spell.target: Up to 5 objects of 11 cubic ft., no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Faiths of Balance, p.28

spell.description: Decrease target objects' weight by half.

spell.name: Magic Siege Engine (Greater)
spell.effect: Siege engine gains +2 on targeting and damage rolls.
spell.description: Siege engine gains +(min(5,floor(CASTERLEVEL/4))) on targeting and damage rolls.

spell.name: Mark of Justice
spell.effect: You mark a subject and state some behavior on the part of the subject that will activate the mark.
spell.description: You mark a subject and state some behavior on the part of the subject that will activate the mark.

spell.name: Pillar of Life
spell.effect: Created pillar heals 2d8 + 11.
spell.target: 5-ft.-square pillar of positive energy, 20 ft. high

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.236

spell.description: Created pillar heals 2d8 + (min(CASTERLEVEL,20)).

spell.name: Plane Shift
spell.effect: You move yourself or some other creature to another plane of existence or alternate dimension.
spell.target: Creature touched, or up to eight willing creatures joining hands
spell.description: You move yourself or some other creature to another plane of existence or alternate dimension.

spell.name: Raise Dead
spell.effect: You restore life to a deceased creature.
spell.description: You restore life to a deceased creature.

spell.name: Rapid Repair
spell.effect: Construct gains fast healing 5.
spell.description: Construct gains fast healing 5.

spell.name: Reprobation
spell.effect: Marked target is shunned by your religion.
spell.description: Marked target is shunned by your religion.

spell.name: Righteous Might
spell.effect: Your height immediately doubles, and your weight increases by a factor of eight.
spell.description: Your height immediately doubles, and your weight increases by a factor of eight.

spell.name: Scrying
spell.effect: You can observe a creature at any distance.
spell.description: You can observe a creature at any distance.

spell.name: Serenity
spell.effect: Peaceful feelings harm those attempting violence.
spell.target: 11 creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
spell.description: Peaceful feelings harm those attempting violence.

spell.name: Slay Living
spell.effect: You can attempt to slay any one living creature.
spell.description: You can attempt to slay any one living creature.

spell.name: Snake Staff
spell.components: V, S, M (a knife suitable for whittling)
spell.effect: Transforms wood into snakes to fight for you.
spell.target: 1 or more pieces of wood, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.245

spell.description: Transforms wood into snakes to fight for you.

spell.name: Spell Immunity (Communal)
spell.effect: As spell immunity, but you may divide the duration among creatures touched.
spell.description: As spell immunity, but you may divide the duration among creatures touched.

spell.name: Spell Resistance
spell.effect: The target gains spell resistance equal to 23.
spell.description: The target gains spell resistance equal to (12+CASTERLEVEL).

spell.name: Summon Monster V
spell.effect: This spell functions like summon monster I, except that you can summon one creature from the 5th-level list, 1d3 creatures of the same kind from the 4th-level list, or 1d4+1 creatures of the same kind from a lower-level list.
spell.description: This spell functions like summon monster I, except that you can summon one creature from the 5th-level list, 1d3 creatures of the same kind from the 4th-level list, or 1d4+1 creatures of the same kind from a lower-level list.

spell.name: Symbol of Scrying
spell.components: V, S, M (1,000 gp powdered diamond and opal)
spell.effect: Triggered rune activates scrying sensor.
spell.description: Triggered rune activates scrying sensor.

spell.name: Symbol of Sleep
spell.effect: This spell functions like symbol of death, except that all creatures of 10 HD or less within 60 feet of the symbol of sleep instead fall into a catatonic slumber for 3d6 *o 10 minutes.
spell.description: This spell functions like symbol of death, except that all creatures of 10 HD or less within 60 feet of the symbol of sleep instead fall into a catatonic slumber for 3d6 *o 10 minutes.

spell.name: Symbol of Striking
spell.components: V, S, M (a masterwork melee weapon costing at least 300 gp)
spell.effect: As symbol of death, but fills a 5-foot square.
spell.description: As symbol of death, but fills a 5-foot square.

spell.name: Tongues (Communal)
spell.effect: As tongues, but you may divide the duration among creatures touched.
spell.description: As tongues, but you may divide the duration among creatures touched.

spell.name: Treasure Stitching
spell.components: V, S, M (a piece of embroidered cloth no larger than 10-ft. square worth 100 gp)
spell.effect: Objects on cloth become embroidered.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.250

spell.description: Objects on cloth become embroidered.

spell.name: True Seeing
spell.effect: You confer on the subject the ability to see all things as they actually are.
spell.description: You confer on the subject the ability to see all things as they actually are.

spell.name: Wall of Stone
spell.effect: This spell creates a wall of rock that merges into adjoining rock surfaces.
spell.target: Stone wall whose area is up to 11 5-ft. squares [S]
spell.description: This spell creates a wall of rock that merges into adjoining rock surfaces.
